source.title: Features | uv
source.description: Overview of uv's command-line interface covering Python version management, script execution, project workflows, tool installation, pip-compatible operations, and cache utilities.

source.title: Working on projects | uv
source.description: Covers project initialisation with uv init, structure including pyproject.toml and uv.lock, dependency management with uv add/remove, running commands with uv run, and building distributions.

source.title: Index | uv
source.description: Hub page linking to detailed concepts: project structure, initialisation, dependencies, running commands, lockfiles, syncing, configuration, building distributions, and workspaces.

source.title: Managing dependencies | uv
source.description: Comprehensive guide to dependency fields, uv add/remove commands, dependency sources (Git, URL, path, workspace), optional dependencies, development groups, build dependencies, editable installations, and dependency specifiers syntax.

source.title: Running commands | uv
source.description: Explains uv run for executing commands in project environments, requesting additional dependencies with --with, running scripts with inline metadata, legacy Windows script support, and signal handling behaviour.

source.title: Configuration files | uv
source.description: Explains project-level pyproject.toml and uv.toml files, user and system configuration hierarchy, settings precedence rules, --no-config and --config-file options, dotenv file loading with UV_ENV_FILE, and uv.pip section for pip-interface configuration.

source.title: Python versions | uv
source.description: Comprehensive guide to requesting, installing, upgrading, discovering, and managing Python versions including version formats, .python-version files, automatic downloads, managed vs system installations, CPython/PyPy/GraalPy support, free-threaded variants, and python-preference settings.

source.title: Building and publishing a package | uv
source.description: Guide to preparing projects for packaging, building distributions with uv build, updating versions with uv version --bump options, publishing to PyPI with uv publish including token authentication and custom indices.

source.title: Using uv with pre-commit | uv
source.description: Demonstrates configuring astral-sh/uv-pre-commit hooks for automatic lockfile updates with uv-lock, exporting requirements with uv-export, and compiling requirements files with pip-compile including multi-file configurations and customisation options.

source.title: Using uv with Jupyter | uv
source.description: Jupyter integration with uv including running notebooks within projects, creating kernels with ipykernel, package installation methods, standalone tool usage, non-project environments, and VS Code setup.

source.title: Installing and managing Python | uv
source.description: Installing Python with uv including specific versions, PyPy, automatic downloads, system Python usage, viewing installations, reinstalling, upgrading patch versions, and managing Python executables.

source.title: Structure and files | uv
source.description: Project structure including pyproject.toml configuration, .venv project environment management with uv run and uv sync, uv.lock universal lockfile for reproducible installations, and pylock.toml export format support.

source.title: Creating projects | uv
source.description: Creating projects with uv init including applications, packaged applications, libraries, extension modules with maturin or scikit-build-core, build backend selection, minimal bare projects, and project structure layouts.

source.title: Locking and syncing | uv
source.description: Lockfile creation and environment syncing with uv lock and uv sync, automatic locking, frozen and locked modes, upgrading packages, syncing extras and development groups, editable installations, and requirements.txt export.

source.title: Configuring projects | uv
source.description: Python version requirements, entry points for CLI and GUI scripts, build systems and packaging, build isolation with extra-build-dependencies, project environment paths, editable mode installation, conflicting dependencies, and platform resolution environments.

source.title: Building distributions | uv
source.description: Building distributions with uv build command for sdists and wheels, build frontend role, output directory options, selective building flags, build constraints, and hash verification for reproducibility.

source.title: Settings | uv
source.description: Complete reference for all uv configuration settings organised into project metadata and configuration categories, documenting dependency management, indexes, caching, Python installation, resolution strategies, build settings, and package installation options.

source.title: Commands | uv
source.description: Comprehensive CLI reference covering all uv commands including run, init, add, remove, sync, lock, export, tree, tool, python, pip, venv, build, publish, with complete syntax, options, and environment variables.

source.title: Build backend | uv
source.description: uv's native build backend for transforming source trees into distributions, covering configuration, module discovery, namespace packages, stub packages, and file inclusion/exclusion patterns for source distributions and wheels.

source.title: Using uv with marimo | uv
source.description: Integrating uv with marimo notebooks as standalone tool, self-contained scripts with inline metadata, within projects, and non-project environments, including dependency management and running notebooks as scripts.

source.title: Using uv in GitHub Actions | uv
source.description: GitHub Actions integration via astral-sh/setup-uv action, Python version setup, matrix testing, dependency syncing with uv sync, cache strategies using enable-cache or actions/cache, private repository authentication, PyPI trusted publishing workflows.
